Class Card

java.lang.Object
Card
Direct Known Subclasses:
Deck, Energy, Pokemon, Trainer
public class Card extends Object
The Card class holds information about the card that is in the deck.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

    • getTypeOfCard

      public String getTypeOfCard()
      Getter method for the typeOfCard variable.

      typeOfCard - The new type of card.

    • getPokemon

      public Pokemon getPokemon()
      Getter method for the pokemon variable
      Returns:
      If the card is a Pokemon, it returns the Pokemon object. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • setPokemon

      public void setPokemon(Pokemon pokemon)
      Setter method for the pokemon variable
      Parameters:
      pokemon - The new Pokemon card.

    • getTrainer

      public Trainer getTrainer()
      Getter method for the trainer variable
      Returns:
      If the card is a Trainer, it returns the Trainer object. Otherwise, it returns null.

      Setter for the trainer variable
      Parameters:
      trainer - The new Trainer card.

    • getEnergy

      public Energy getEnergy()
      The getEnergy method returns the Energy object associated with the Card.
      Returns:
      If the card is an Energy, it returns the Energy object. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • setEnergy

      public void setEnergy(Energy energy)
      Setter method for the energy variable
      Parameters:
      energy - The new Energy card.

    • getNameOfCard

      Getter for the nameOfCard variable
      Returns:
      The name of the card

    • setNameOfCard

      public void setNameOfCard(String nameOfCard)
      Setter for the nameOfCard variable
      Parameters:
      nameOfCard - The new name of the card

    • checkForMulligan

      public boolean checkForMulligan(ArrayList<Card> hand)
      The checkForMulligan method checks to see if the current hand has no pokemon in it.
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand of cards that needs to be checked.
      Returns:
      A boolean value: true - if a mulligan has not been detected, false = if a mulligan has been found.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      The toString method overrides the toString method for this object and instead returns the name of the card.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The name of the card
